title: Booker?
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150302015304im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20Shot%202015-01-28%20at%203_5486.42.49%20PM.png)

I inherited this font that I believe is called "Booker" but I cant find any license information for it on the web — does anyone know where it might have come from/who the designer might be?

If nothing else, I would love to find a similar font that is available for commercial use.
author: nonninoel

comments.content:
The copyright of a Booker font says: "1995 Solotech Design. All Rights Reserved."  
According to Luc Devroye info on Solotech:  
 [http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-29677.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150302015304/http:/luc.devroye.org/fonts-29677.html "http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-29677.html")

> "[...] some of their fonts (if not all) are exact unaltered copies of other people's fonts."

Therefore I don't think the original font name was "Booker".

This is one of these fonts copied/sold by many forgery companies under different names and although I doubt any of them is the original design, I'll list them here to help discovering the original:  
**Booker** - 1995 Solotech Design. All Rights Reserved.  
**Dishrow** - Converted to PC format for distribution by Reaso  
**Eliza** - Generated by Fontographer 3.5  
**Enterprise** - (C) 1992-1993. ATTITUDE, INC. All Rights Reserved.  
**Marathon 3 / 4 / 7 / 8** - Cambridge Fontworks  
**Rosehill** - (no copyright info)  
**RUGGELLfont** - Copyright Arcmedia.com Inc.  
**TavisSSi** - Copyright 1995 Southern Software, Inc., All Rights Reserved  
**TavisSSK** - Copyright 1995 Southern Software, Inc.,  
**Upright** - Generated by Metamorphosis Professional 2.03  
**Upsilon** - Fantazia Fonts and Sounds  
**Upsilon** - Converted to PC format for distribution by Reasonable Solutions, Inc.  
**Upsilon** - Copyright 1991, Atech Software, Carlsbad CA

Looks like almost all of the major font pirates from the wild west era of the early 1990s took a crack at this one. Perhaps originally a Mac font with the name Upsilon?  
Don
